title: Set-Top Box Market in Brazil 2015-2019
text:
ReportBuyer
LONDON , Oct. 13, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- About set-top box
An STB is a device that is connected to a TV in a user's premise. It enables end-users to receive unencrypted subscribed channels through an addressable system for viewing encrypted channels. The STB connects a TV to an external signal source and transforms the AV signal into video content, which is displayed on the screen. STBs can convert both analogue and digital signals into NTSC/PAL/SECAM color encoding system. In Brazil , PAL/SECAM color encoding system is used.
Technavio's analysts forecast the set-top box market in Brazil to grow at a CAGR of 37.01% over the period 2014-2019.
Covered in this report
The report covers the present scenario and the growth prospects of the STB market in Brazil for 2015-2019. The market size is calculated on the basis of the revenue generated from the shipments of STBs in Brazil that include cable, IPTV, and DTH . DTH is the reception of satellite programmes through personal dish. In cable TV, an operator does the transmission. IPTV lets the user to view streaming media over the packet-switched network using Internet Protocol.
Technavio's report, Set-Top Box Market in Brazil 2015-2019, has been prepared based on an in-depth market analysis with inputs from industry experts. The report covers the landscape of the set-top box market in Brazil and its growth prospects in the coming years. The report includes a discussion of the key vendors operating in this market.
